The Elder Tiraṁsi
Like a lion, born in the forest,
like a mass of fire on a mountain,
Shining in all directions,

analyzed: siddhattham pabbata antare  sūriyassa ca āloka
translated: Siddhattha, in the mountains.🔽The light of the sun,
and the light of the moon,
and seeing the light of the Buddha,
I was filled with joy.
Seeing the three lights,
the Buddha, the best of disciples,
I put my outer robe over one shoulder,
and I consoled the Leader of the World.
There are three who bring light,
in the world, dispelling the darkness of the world:
The moon, the sun,
and the Buddha, the Leader of the World.
Having given a simile,
the Great Sage was praised by me;
Having praised the Buddha,
for an eon I rejoiced in heaven.
For ninety-four eons,
I praised the Buddha;
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the praise.
For sixty-one eons,
I was one who upheld knowledge,
endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful wheel-turning monarch.
